intro: Melampyrum vulgatum ovatum, commonly known as the common touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and pairs of opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its name "touch-me-not" refers to the sticky, glandular hairs on its stems that make it difficult to grasp.
